_prev_prog_3.CT_OtherType: Comprehension of the training is evaluated throughout the training session.  All materials (SOP's, PHA) are reviewed as a group and collectively indicated whether any changes/modifications are req
_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: The following equipment is inspected daily: all compressors, receivers (HP-1, PR-1), purger, water tank, pumps, surge drum for WC-1, all evaporators
_prev_prog_3.Description: The following prevention program elements are applicable for the Farmer's Pride, Inc. ammonia refrigeration system: 1)Standard operating procedures have been developed for all internal maintenace work performed on the system.  All procedures are included within the RMP and all maintenance personnel receive comprehensive training prior to performing any work on the system. 2) Colonial Industrial Refrigeration, Incis the contractor utilized for providing services to the system above and beyond routine maintenance. Colonial provides excellent service and maintains an outstanding safety record.  3)A Manning Ammonia Detection system is in place in order to detect any system release.  System detection locations include the following: engine room, vent line, coolers, freezer, CVP, dock, deboning. 4) Any intended changes to the process chemicals, technology, equipment, procedures, or to the facility require that standard management of change procedures are followed.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Farmer's Pride, Inc., of Fredericksburg, PA, processes approximately 3,000,000 lbs. of live weight poultry into finished product per week.  We are committed to supplying consumers with quality product and maintaining a safe environment for our employees, visitors, and community.  Ammonia is used at our facility as the cooling medium in our refrigeration systems.  Ammonia is used in coolers, freezers, and production rooms to keep the chicken at appropriate temperatures.  The ammonia is contained in a closed loop system within the piping and vessels located in our facility.

A) Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:  Farmer's Pride, Inc. has implemented many precautionary measures to minimize accidental releases of ammonia from its refrigeration system.  Precautions include safety controls (Manning ammonia detection system, automatic shutdown devices) which are designed to identify and prevent potentially unsafe conditions such as pressure increases that could casue system malfunctions.  In addition, all maintenance personnel performing preventive maintenance on the system are qualified and thoroughly trained.  Maintenance personnel are required to follow the written standard operating procedures (sop's) developed for each maintenance task performed on the system.  The Maintenance Manager is responsible for the management of these ammonia safety programs. 

B) Stationary source and regulated substance handled:  Farmer's Pride, Inc. operates a refrigeration system with an ammonia inventory of approximately 16,277 pounds. 
 
C) Accidental Release Prevention Program:  Farmer's Pride, Inc. maintains an Accidental Release Prevetnion Program that complies with 29 CFR 1910.119 and EPA's Risk Management Program regulation.  The program includes the following elements:  employee participation program, process safety information, process hazard analysis (checklist), operating procedures, training program, contractor safety program, pre-start up safety re

view procedures, mechanical integrity program, hot work permit procedures, management of change procedures, incident investigation procedures, compliance audit procedures.

D)  Farmer's Pride Inc. has had no ammonia-related accidents in the past five years.

E)  Emergency Response Program:  Farmer's Pride, Inc. has implemented an Emergency Response Program that contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to ammonia spills/releases, fires, and other emergencies.  The plan was designed to comply with OSHA standards 29 CFR 1910.38 and 1910.120.

F)  Planned Changes to Improve Safety:  Farmer's Pride, Inc. continuously evaluates the ammonia system equipment and procedures in order to maintain a safe work environment. RMP and PSM compliance audits will be conducted internally on a regular basis.  All safety improvement measures will be implemented as appropriate.
